RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $ 8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HERETODAYGONMANANA saved ground on the opening turn, started a bid past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn in the four and five paths, closed steadily leaving the turn and got up in the final yards. MAKINLIMMARGARITAS rated a short lead off the rail, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths pole, extended her lead at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady handling leaving the turn, but was caught in the final yards. EX RATED rounded the opening turn in the three path, left the turn outside and gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn, angled to the rail entering the stretch and finished well. DIVA ROSE came through the first turn in the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, was shut off entering the stretch, was eased out past the eighth pole and improved position. TRUE FLIRT stalked the earlier pace from the four path, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and showed little more. KNOBIESMAGICSONDE stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Heretodaygonmanana
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 7/16,4& 5p far turn,steadily closed,up late

ENTRY.NAME: Makinlimmargaritas
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace off rail,pressured 5/16,rail far turn,caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowe d 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TENNIS TAP steadied leaving the gate then saved ground, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn, took over then lugged in past the sixteenth pole and drew clear later yards. JACKYSINTHECASTLE saved ground close to the pace on the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn, was forced out then crowded past the eighth pole, recovered stride and got up for second leaving the sixteenth pole. ELLIES AT WINDSOR stalked two deep on the first turn then took the nod past the half mile pole, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn, drifted into the stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. APPEALING ROAD settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn near the rail, eased out leaving the turn and passed some rivals. WAGER WORTHY stalked from the three path on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole then weakened into the far turn. BLUE MOUNTAIN became a bit edgy in the gate, took the lead at the rail and rated the pace, was met past the half mile pole, gave chase from that point but weakened at the rail on the far turn. SARAH'S WARRIOR became anxious in the gate, raced in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Tennis Tap for alleged interference leaving the far turn, lodged by the rider of Jackysinthecastle.

ENTRY.NAME: Appealing Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,rail far turn,passed rivals lane

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Mountain
ENTRY.COMMENT: edgy gate,rated pace,met past 1/2,chased,weakened rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Tennis Tap
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOUL CATCHER angled in and steadied off the heels of horses early, rounded the first turn in the three path, bid approaching the three eighths pole and came through the far turn in the three path, dug in the final sixteenth and got up nearing the wire. RACING HOT LINE was pinched back soon after the start then settled inside, bid nearing the three eighths pole and took the lead two deep at the quarter, dug in leaving the far turn but was caught in the final strides. YACHTSMEN raced well back off the rail, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path, eased out leaving the turn and finished well while gaining on the top two. LOVE IS WICKED saved ground, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and passed some rivals. ALEXANDER GRADY raced in the seven path the first turn then moved to the inside past the half mile pole, gave chase nearing the three eighths, rounded the far turn about the three path and passed some rivals. CANDY FOR JUBA lugged in early then drifted into the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, took a brief slim lead approaching the quarter pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then weakened. CHRISTOPHER'SHEART was forced out into the first turn and raced in the five path through the turn, took the lead at the half mile pole, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths, was met toward the quarter, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened. GOGO GADGET was forced inward early then stalked off the rail, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. BRADLEY DO RIGHT took the lead into the first turn, was met into the backstretch and briefly gave chase before fading. VALHALLA'S PALACE raced outside into the backstretch, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole then weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Yachtsmen
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back,bid 3/8,4p far turn,finished well,gaining top two

ENTRY.NAME: Soul Catcher
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied early,3p 1st turn,bid 3/8,3p far turn,up near wire

ENTRY.NAME: Valhalla's Palace
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Alexander Grady
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Steinmann Eric

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: A LITTLE BIT CRAZY stalked from the four path the first turn and took the nod passing the half mile pole, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths, rounded the far turn near the rail and was steadily handled to hold on. MIDNIGHT REGRET settled close in the four path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and finished evenly at the outside girth of the winner. HIGHWAY QUEEN rounded the opening turn in the three path, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and ran evenly in the stretch. HOVEL saved early ground racing well off the pace, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and improved position. IRISH SAMURAI rounded the first turn in the five path, gave chase from the three eighths pole but flattened in the five path on the far turn. SEEMS TO WHISPER raced with the pace inside, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. STOPWATCHSONNY rated close inside on the opening turn then faded through the backstretch. SURCHARGE raced with the early pace two deep then faded after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Seems to Whisper
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John

ENTRY.NAME: Surcharge
ENTRY.OWNER: CM Racing and Jones Jr Michael E

ENTRY.NAME: Hovel
ENTRY.OWNER: McCormick Gloria F and O'Hara Vicki

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8, 000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMOKIN LADY bobbled leaving the gate then stalked two deep, challenged past the three eighths pole, took over two deep at the five sixteenths, dug in under steady stretch handling and held on well. DENALI D'ORO rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the four path on the far turn, closed for second later yards and finished well. PRINCESS HALO stalked from the four path the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close in the three path on the far turn but flattened stride later yards. DEREKA'S BLUFF settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. OUR GREAT NOTION moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met passing the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. ODINA rounded the first turn about the four path and bid only mildly leaving the seven sixteenths pole. SNEAKY LYNK raced off the rail on the first turn, showed little response through the backstretch and came through the far turn about the five path. HOOK THE CHAIN and PETTYFORURTHOUGHTS saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Dereka's Bluff
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased past 1/2,rail far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GAMMA SQUEEZE took the lead while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the advantage over BON BUENO, who settled in the three path the first turn and started a four wide bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced close two deep on the far turn and continued to pressure the winner through the stretch. RAGTIME RICHES saved ground on the first turn then eased out entering the backstretch, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. SURF CITY GOLD rated close inside, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little further. ZALFIERRO settled off the rail on the first turn, started a three wide bid nearing the three eighths pole but faded into the far turn. MR. COWBOY BRADLEY tapered in and stalked the pace two deep, challenged approaching the three eighths pole but weakened past the five sixteenths. SEIZE THE BREEZE saved ground racing well back.

ENTRY.NAME: Bon Bueno
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3p 1st turn,4wd bid 3/8,close 2d turn,game stretch factor

ENTRY.NAME: Surf City Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Gardner Sean and MIH Affiliates LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Ragtime Riches
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out 1/2,chased 3/8,3p far turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Zalfierro
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,3wd bid 3/8,faded into far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since August 16 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 16 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FEARNOUGHT stalked two deep then challenged into the backstretch, contested at a close disadvantage through the far turn but dug in undeterred to take the nod in the final strides. MISSIONSNINETYNINE was bumped then jostled at the start but took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and rated the pace, kept the edge over Fearnought leaving the half mile pole and contested the advantage at the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling leaving the turn but reluctantly ceded the nod in the final strides. SHAMELESS RISK came in and made contact with Missionsninetynine leaving the gate and rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced close three wide on the far turn but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. RIVER CROSROAD RVF was forced out entering the first turn then moved to the inside into the backstretch, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. RUN TO DAYLIGHT rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE came out and made contact with Missionsninetynine leaving the gate then drifted into the first turn and was no factor racing wide.

ENTRY.NAME: Missionsninetynine
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,rated pace,kept edge from 1/2,rail turn,reluctantly

ENTRY.NAME: Shameless Risk
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Fearnought
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,challenged 1/2,close turn,dug in lane,nod final strdes

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligib ility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIVERVIEW STEVIE stalked two deep then bid nearing the three eighths pole, took the lead three wide midway on the far turn and was kept alert to maintain the edge over RIDE THE RAPIDS, who stalked from the three path the first turn and gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, drew close at the rail toward the head of the lane but reluctantly ceded the final sixteenth. MY SISTER PAM raced off the rail on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, was in range in the four path on the far turn but flattened stride into the lane. WICKED WISDOM saved ground on the first turn, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn then flattened in the lane. WEST VIRGINIA PAM rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but flattened near the rail on the far turn. BROADWAY PEGGY moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met and dropped back from between horses toward the head of the lane and weakened. WISHING FOR SPRING entered the first turn in the six path, left the turn outside and gave chase from the three eighths pole then flattened at the rail on the far turn. LILY'S LEAD was not a factor. WICKED SAUCY drifted into the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole then faded through the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: West Virginia Pam
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,flattened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Lily's Lead
ENTRY.OWNER: Vina Del Mar Thoroughbreds LLC and Van Pelt Charlotte M

ENTRY.NAME: Riverview Stevie
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,bid 3/8,up 3wd mid turn,kept alert to maintain
